metadata.title: CVE-2019-9813 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect handling of __proto__ mutations may lead to type confusion inIonMonkey JIT code and can be leveraged for arbitrary memory read andwrite. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.0.1, Firefox ESR < 60.6.1,and Thunderbird < 60.6.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
